thread.title: Man accused of killing girlfriend's abuser pleads not guilty -
thread.title_full: Man accused of killing girlfriend's abuser pleads not guilty - FOX 8 WVUE New Orleans News, Weather, Sports, Social

author: cbs8
title: Man accused of killing girlfriend's abuser pleads not guilty -
text:
BATON ROUGE, La. (AP) - A 21-year-old man who investigators say admitted to killing his girlfriend's abuser has pleaded not guilty to a second-degree murder charge in the July slaying.
Media outlets in Louisiana report that Jace Crehan of Walker entered his plea Wednesday in Baton Rouge. Crehan faces an automatic sentence of life in prison if convicted.
Authorities say the body of 47-year-old Robert Noce Jr. was discovered July 4 in his Zachary home. Sheriff's officials say Crehan admitted to stabbing and strangling Noce and putting his body in a plastic drum. Officials say Crehan also placed his girlfriend at the crime scene.
Officials say Noce had just begun serving probation for sexually abusing the 18-year-old woman, who was Crehan's girlfriend, when she was a child.
Crehan's attorney, Carson Marcantel, declined comment.
